commit_message:
Install python memcache package

When a component uses authtoken and has memcache servers specified
we should be installing the python-memcache package to satisfy the
dependency. Currently in mitaka, for example, if we have memcache
specified for say glance, it will error out because memcache is
not by default installed too.

Change-Id: I24f09937ed699479e164fdc18e149cde1695055d
Closes-Bug: #1618125

This patch adjusts the package installation/removal tasks to get around
a bug. Jinja2 now returns namedtuples with the groupby filter and
Ansible is unable to convert that to a usable variable data type with
AST.

Jinja2 bug: pallets/jinja#654

commit_message:
Remove groupby filter to avoid bug

This patch adjusts the package installation/removal tasks to get around
a bug. Jinja2 now returns namedtuples with the groupby filter and
Ansible is unable to convert that to a usable variable data type with
AST.

Jinja2 bug: pallets/jinja#654
Ansible bug: ansible/ansible#20098
Related-Bug: 1655397
Change-Id: I3ce764bfb643bda58c4b6ad282e71c312f41465e

commit_message:
Pass correct object to docker driver in docker driver unit test

1.use mock.MagicMock() to mock zun.objects.Container instead of
db_models.Container in unit test suit for docker driver

commit_message:
cinder: configure dlm when this one is zookeeper

Previous this was set the zake, but that was revert to missing
dependencies issue and because zake is a test fixture and not somthing
to deploy.

This change configures the Cinder dlm with this one is zookeeper.
And it installs tooz and the extra dependencies needed for the
zookeeper driver.

To do it, this commit have to introduce a new method for package
installation: 'pip_install_gr_extras package extra1,extra2'.

Change-Id: Idca310c08e345db59840eb31434c6cb1f849fa70

subject: Fix apt discrepancy around mysql client package
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8786, 'name': 'Vladimir Kuklin', 'email': 'aglarendil@gmail.com', 'username': 'aglarendil'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11827, 'name': 'Stanislaw Bogatkin', 'email': 'regs+ubuntu.com@sbog.ru', 'username': 'sbogatkin'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-09 16:49:47.000000000', 'files': ['tests/noop/spec/hosts/database/database_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/database/database.pp'], 'message': 'Fix apt discrepancy around mysql client package

When we run galera/mysql packages installation
we can get into dependencies issues with  mysql
client package as it is not installed at the time
when perl dbd module requires it. At the same time
libperl-dbd-mysql is depending on it, so it fails.
Instead we need to ensure that mysql client is installed
along with its libraries prior to installing additional
packages for galera.

Change-Id: Idc91a399a46cd63c2201660bb248c0a0ad3fb9b8
Closes-bug: #1651182
'}]
commit_message:
Fix apt discrepancy around mysql client package

When we run galera/mysql packages installation
we can get into dependencies issues with  mysql
client package as it is not installed at the time
when perl dbd module requires it. At the same time
libperl-dbd-mysql is depending on it, so it fails.
Instead we need to ensure that mysql client is installed
along with its libraries prior to installing additional
packages for galera.

Change-Id: Idc91a399a46cd63c2201660bb248c0a0ad3fb9b8
Closes-bug: #1651182

commit_message:
fullstack: Use iptables firewall in linuxbridge agents

We should cover as much code base with fullstack as possible. Even
though we don't explicitly test security groups, we still can test
chains preparation with iptables firewall driver in linux bridge
fullstack tests.

Change-Id: Ieac18a6ea2b9a362d0966c2d8dcb44d85fd91ad2
Closes-bug: 1577457

subject: Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-03 11:51:50.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/utils/rpc.py'], 'message': 'Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher

oslo.messaging allow dispatcher to restrict endpoint methods since
5.11.0 in d3a8f280ebd6fd12865fd20c4d772774e39aefa2, the default
value of access_policy is LegacyRPCAccessPolicy.
set with DefaultRPCAccessPolicy to fix FutureWarning like:

"The access_policy argument is changing its default value to <class
'oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.DefaultRPCAccessPolicy'> in version 'xxx',
please update the code to explicitly set None as the value:
access_policy defaults to LegacyRPCAccessPolicy which exposes private
methods. Explicitly set access_policy to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy or
ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy."

Change-Id: I7a220e6fc27e30dbbde4326c071a3f0390f6da43
'}]
commit_message:
Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher

oslo.messaging allow dispatcher to restrict endpoint methods since
5.11.0 in d3a8f280ebd6fd12865fd20c4d772774e39aefa2, the default
value of access_policy is LegacyRPCAccessPolicy.
set with DefaultRPCAccessPolicy to fix FutureWarning like:

"The access_policy argument is changing its default value to <class
'oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.DefaultRPCAccessPolicy'> in version 'xxx',
please update the code to explicitly set None as the value:
access_policy defaults to LegacyRPCAccessPolicy which exposes private
methods. Explicitly set access_policy to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy or
ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy."

Change-Id: I7a220e6fc27e30dbbde4326c071a3f0390f6da43

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-11-06 13:57:51.000000000', 'files': ['spec/unit/provider/neutron_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/neutron.rb'], 'message': 'Add custom "neutron" command override

This patch adds a custom "neutron" command
implementation. It outputs only stdout of
the python cli tool and drops the stderr.
If error have happened both stdout and
stderr go to the exception message.

This can fix the situation when neutron
tool outputs several non-critical warnings
and they break the output parser in the
provider.

Change-Id: Iac219acd48dc07e1158915657694f59918051255
'}]
commit_message:
Add custom "neutron" command override

This patch adds a custom "neutron" command
implementation. It outputs only stdout of
the python cli tool and drops the stderr.
If error have happened both stdout and
stderr go to the exception message.

This can fix the situation when neutron
tool outputs several non-critical warnings
and they break the output parser in the
provider.

Change-Id: Iac219acd48dc07e1158915657694f59918051255

commit_message:
Refactor admin_token_auth

The new versions of the ini_subsetting provider allows
inserting a section to the specified location in the pipeline
making a class to enable and disable admin_token_auth possible.

subject: Configure local registries to proxy docker hub
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-01-06 19:48:58.000000000', 'files': ['doc/multinode.rst', 'tools/start-registry'], 'message': 'Configure local registries to proxy docker hub

Added the REGISTRY_PROXY_REMOTEURL parameter to the registry
creation script, so that the registry will mirror images from
Docker Hub (while still being able to host custom-built images).
Updated the Multinode guide to reflect this.

Change-Id: Ib789241fd2947b06fb0dc5732a0bf28431e1403d
Closes-Bug: #1647436
'}]
commit_message:
Configure local registries to proxy docker hub

Added the REGISTRY_PROXY_REMOTEURL parameter to the registry
creation script, so that the registry will mirror images from
Docker Hub (while still being able to host custom-built images).
Updated the Multinode guide to reflect this.

Change-Id: Ib789241fd2947b06fb0dc5732a0bf28431e1403d
Closes-Bug: #1647436

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}, {'_account_id': 23273, 'name': 'Tobias Diaz', 'email': 'tobias.deb@gmail.com', 'username': 'int-0'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-11 03:35:27.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bug-1616105-cc8b85eb056e99e2.yaml', 'keystoneclient/tests/unit/test_session.py', 'keystoneclient/session.py'], 'message': 'Only log application/json in session to start

When whitelisting content types to debug print from session we chose
application/json and application/text. application/text is not a real
mime type, text is typically text/plain.

Rather than guess at mime types only print application/json to start
with, but make it easy for additional types to be added later.

Adapted from keystoneauth: Ica5fee076cdab8b1d5167161d28af7313fad9477
Related-Bug: 1616105

Change-Id: Ieaa8fb3ea8d25e09b89498f23b70b18c0f6153f1
'}]
commit_message:
Only log application/json in session to start

When whitelisting content types to debug print from session we chose
application/json and application/text. application/text is not a real
mime type, text is typically text/plain.

Rather than guess at mime types only print application/json to start
with, but make it easy for additional types to be added later.

Adapted from keystoneauth: Ica5fee076cdab8b1d5167161d28af7313fad9477
Related-Bug: 1616105

Change-Id: Ieaa8fb3ea8d25e09b89498f23b70b18c0f6153f1

commit_message:
Refactor test case for ml2 mech driver(port)

This patch makes the test case atomic.

Since the test case for allowed address pair has been moved out at [1],
port security has been moved out at [2], and remote port has been
moved out at [3]. This patch just removes the test for them in the
original big test case.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/386325/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/392133/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/393674/

Change-Id: Idcbe4d07f38741cfbb69a12aea5df1b35d466c14
Partial-Bug: #1633078

subject: dpdk: could not bind or unbind nic in the latest release
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-06 02:21:35.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/override-defaults', 'devstack/ovs_dpdk_setup.sh'], 'message': 'dpdk: could not bind or unbind nic in the latest release

The new stable release dpdk package changes the script name
of binding/unbinding nics. This change causes bug in df.

This commit also makes dpdk deployment more stable.

Co-Authored-By: Li Ma <skywalker.nick@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1652867
Change-Id: Ifd41965eb72cd8eabe2bbe94c46ba031233c6ae3
'}]
commit_message:
dpdk: could not bind or unbind nic in the latest release

The new stable release dpdk package changes the script name
of binding/unbinding nics. This change causes bug in df.

This commit also makes dpdk deployment more stable.

Co-Authored-By: Li Ma <skywalker.nick@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1652867
Change-Id: Ifd41965eb72cd8eabe2bbe94c46ba031233c6ae3

subject: dpdk: could not load igb_uio.ko when install df
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7805, 'name': 'Li Ma', 'email': 'skywalker.nick@gmail.com', 'username': 'Nick'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 11159, 'name': 'Hong Hui Xiao', 'email': 'honghui_xiao@yeah.net', 'username': 'HongHuiXiao'}, {'_account_id': 20229, 'name': 'Omer Anson', 'email': 'omer.anson@toganetworks.com', 'username': 'oanson'}, {'_account_id': 20287, 'name': 'hujie', 'email': 'mike.hu@huawei.com', 'username': 'hujie'}, {'_account_id': 23235, 'name': 'Lihi Wishnitzer', 'email': 'lihiwish@gmail.com', 'username': 'lihiwish'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-28 05:48:41.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/ovs_dpdk_setup.sh'], 'message': 'dpdk: could not load igb_uio.ko when install df

The igb_uio.ko needs to be compiled in advance. The devstack
should firstly compile igb_uio.ko and then load uio for ovs-dpdk.

If the igb_uio.ko exists in your system, this bug cannot be identified.

Co-Authored-By: Li Ma <skywalker.nick@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1652866
Change-Id: I2bae175ea549427f5f95c3933499fc1864bae147
'}]
commit_message:
dpdk: could not load igb_uio.ko when install df

The igb_uio.ko needs to be compiled in advance. The devstack
should firstly compile igb_uio.ko and then load uio for ovs-dpdk.

If the igb_uio.ko exists in your system, this bug cannot be identified.

Co-Authored-By: Li Ma <skywalker.nick@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1652866
Change-Id: I2bae175ea549427f5f95c3933499fc1864bae147

subject: Fix "create_nova_conf_neutron command not found"
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-11 07:46:02.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Fix "create_nova_conf_neutron command not found"

It can be observed when install a compute node. The function is in
devstack/lib/neutron-legacy. And neutron-legacy will not be sourced if
there is no "q-*" service.

Change to use same function defined in devstack/lib/neutron

Change-Id: If811a3165a0356c369cb5204e912cc2145e39138
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "create_nova_conf_neutron command not found"

It can be observed when install a compute node. The function is in
devstack/lib/neutron-legacy. And neutron-legacy will not be sourced if
there is no "q-*" service.

Change to use same function defined in devstack/lib/neutron

Change-Id: If811a3165a0356c369cb5204e912cc2145e39138

commit_message:
Unmanage and manage snapshots

This feature provides the ability to import/export volume snapshot
from one Cinder to another and to import snapshots that have not been
managed by Cinder from a storage back end to Cinder.

Added:
- Api for snapshot-unmange
- Api for snapshot-manage
- New client 'snapshot_manage_client'
- 'delete_snapshot' method
Note: Cinder V1 does not support unmanage & manage snapshot.

Change-Id: Ib02fe171b07814aa12d311171dceac834ecbfe39

commit_message:
First Prepare for Sphinx 1.5

The new sphinx version introduces some changes that break build:

* Warns if code cannot be parsed for highlighting. Fix the code so that
  it can be parsed, this includes uncommenting "..." lines.
* :option: works only with declared options, replace useage with simple
  ``.

This change only handles a few files, more to come later.

Change-Id: I957b102a0b3fb84f494e7f50ec35fa1c26a98bb5

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-12-08 18:35:31.000000000', 'files': ['specs/not-implemented/openbmc-driver.rst', 'specs/approved/openbmc-driver.rst'], 'message': "Add spec for OpenBMC driver

Currently IPMI is not fully supported by OpenBMC. Instead,
OpenBMC's power and boot device is controlled through a
RESTful interface. While IPMI may be a supported mechanism
in the future for OpenBMC, the recommended way to interact
with it will continue to be its RESTful API. This means that
servers running OpenBMC will require a new module to control
its power, a new module to set the boot device, and a hardware
type that has these modules supported. This patch adds
a spec for these items.

Partial-bug: #1634635
Change-Id: Ie272f3ad2d4ae5bcb1bd542007dfcdb4adfcb799
"}]
commit_message:
Add spec for OpenBMC driver

Currently IPMI is not fully supported by OpenBMC. Instead,
OpenBMC's power and boot device is controlled through a
RESTful interface. While IPMI may be a supported mechanism
in the future for OpenBMC, the recommended way to interact
with it will continue to be its RESTful API. This means that
servers running OpenBMC will require a new module to control
its power, a new module to set the boot device, and a hardware
type that has these modules supported. This patch adds
a spec for these items.

Partial-bug: #1634635
Change-Id: Ie272f3ad2d4ae5bcb1bd542007dfcdb4adfcb799

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-26 14:08:18.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/tools/ironic/templates/vm.xml'], 'message': "[devstack] Export VNC console for localhost only

Change default VNC console settings for nodes created as virtual baremetal
nodes by ironic's DevStack plugin to create the vm's VMC console to
localhost only.

With current setting ('0.0.0.0' == 'all interfaces') it is impossible to
attach to the VNC console when devstack is not running on the host where
vnc client is running, for example with virt-manager.

Change-Id: Ifddf4765c13f58018ed460b2974702dd57d569ba
"}]
commit_message:
[devstack] Export VNC console for localhost only

Change default VNC console settings for nodes created as virtual baremetal
nodes by ironic's DevStack plugin to create the vm's VMC console to
localhost only.

With current setting ('0.0.0.0' == 'all interfaces') it is impossible to
attach to the VNC console when devstack is not running on the host where
vnc client is running, for example with virt-manager.

Change-Id: Ifddf4765c13f58018ed460b2974702dd57d569ba

commit_message:
Add new Midonet plugin package

Starting with newton release the midonet python plugin
is split into 2 , one which has the basic functionality
and another which has extensions to be able to interact
with LBaaS V2 for example.

Change-Id: I0979e119bb0fcb67b9e23b038b33d24b9e334228

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-21 19:25:17.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_nfs.py'], 'message': "Tests: Split up NFS backup notification test

This test writes backup data to disk multiple times,
which means it no longer works when bug 1628768 is
fixed.

For now, split it into three separate tests which don't
write into the same path.

A suggested later step would be to mock out all writes
to disk.

Related-Bug: #1628768

Change-Id: I8c569d87f5a3e8e3eaf23b676ec73a412cb51d43
"}]
commit_message:
Tests: Split up NFS backup notification test

This test writes backup data to disk multiple times,
which means it no longer works when bug 1628768 is
fixed.

For now, split it into three separate tests which don't
write into the same path.

A suggested later step would be to mock out all writes
to disk.

Related-Bug: #1628768

Change-Id: I8c569d87f5a3e8e3eaf23b676ec73a412cb51d43

When creating a group with a group type name, an exception
was raised: AttributeError: 'dict' object has no attribute 'id'
This is because group_types.get_group_type_by_name returns a

commit_message:
Fix create_group with group type name

When creating a group with a group type name, an exception
was raised: AttributeError: 'dict' object has no attribute 'id'
This is because group_types.get_group_type_by_name returns a
dictionary of a group type, not an object. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I36c0ccd6262dfb392241b2898f57ecaef5dc5162
Closes-Bug: #1654098

commit_message:
Merge project and user id in a creator field

This patches merge the user and project identifier in a single field
which is creator (for created_by_*) for resources and metrics. The old
fields are still returned, and still works as they are translated to the
equivalent creator fields.

Change-Id: I05dad874218aa9139a83e73c5ba2af638501ad9e

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-13 16:31:05.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/openstack/api_version_request.py', 'cinder/api/openstack/wsgi.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/openstack/test_api_version_request.py'], 'message': "Make APIVersionRequest's null check more pythonic

Our current APIVersionRequest object has an is_null method to check when
the version instance is null (major=None and minor=None).

While this works it is not very pythonic, since you have to write
expressions such as:

 if not min_version and not max_version:
     return True
 elif ((min_version and max_version) and
       max_version.is_null() and min_version.is_null()):
     return True

This patch removes the is_null method and instead implements the truth
value testing to simplify expressions and make code more pythonic.

So previous code would just look like:

 if not min_version and not max_version:
     return True

Because this will work with min_version being None or being an
APIVersionRequest instance with major=None and minor=None.

Change-Id: Id02669ccebb2aaa8f899242a5a0fbc2d44888796
"}]
commit_message:
Make APIVersionRequest's null check more pythonic

Our current APIVersionRequest object has an is_null method to check when
the version instance is null (major=None and minor=None).

While this works it is not very pythonic, since you have to write
expressions such as:

 if not min_version and not max_version:
     return True
 elif ((min_version and max_version) and
       max_version.is_null() and min_version.is_null()):
     return True

This patch removes the is_null method and instead implements the truth
value testing to simplify expressions and make code more pythonic.

So previous code would just look like:

 if not min_version and not max_version:
     return True

Because this will work with min_version being None or being an
APIVersionRequest instance with major=None and minor=None.

Change-Id: Id02669ccebb2aaa8f899242a5a0fbc2d44888796

commit_message:
Plugin rename is denied

Plugin name is uses as identifier in sync operations. Plugins data
on the file system can be found only by it's name, so renaming of
the plugin must be denied.

Change-Id: I2864537770f27d3b95d0d093900c1a787fef107c
Closes-Bug: #1649568
(cherry picked from commit f7debcb38d63e6c3f9f38fa9d8bb4e7457d7cf91)

commit_message:
cinder.conf either supports lvm or ceph backend, not both

Cinder can be configured to support either
lvm or ceph backend. Using both backends only enables lvm
as the ceph backend configuration is combined
with the lvm backend part via elif code.

Change-Id: I57e515cf7cdd6377d60bfbc45a889553ce87207a
Closes-Bug: #1654996

commit_message:
WIP: Create ProcessedNetworkRequest object

We have to query neutron several times during the boot process to
validate the user's network_request. Currently we don't share state
between these various calls until network_info_cache is created.

To pass information between validate_networks, create_ports and
allocate_for_instance phases, we are creating a new object called
ProcessedNetworkRequest, that contains a NetworkRequest object.

Eventually this will mean when we create a port in one phase the next
phase can tell between a pre-existing port passed in by a user and the
new port that has been created by Nova, that should be deleted when the
instance is deleted.

TODO - this is just some initial stabs in the code at where the changes
need to go. Its likely this could just get rolled into the existing
NetworkRequest object, but for now its separate just for clarity.

blueprint prep-for-network-aware-scheduling-ocata

Change-Id: Id08e4ec118d8c5c39d34990a82647605fa076852

commit_message:
WIP: make _filter_hypervisor_macs use objects

Instead of passing in the raw dict of ports from neutron, instead pass
in the new ProcessedNetworkRequestList object. Also populate the object
with a mac_address so _filter_hypervisor_macs gets what it needs.

This now means _validate_req_and_create_ports no longer needs to return
the raw ports from neutron. Win.

Lots of the test fixes are about using real mac addresses, now we use an
object that validates the fields correctly. There are also some bad
default return values for ports, now that gets used.

blueprint prep-for-network-aware-scheduling-ocata

Change-Id: I33fa471ebb9f7cb2a0e526ba8c24ae9c083a6f61

commit_message:
WIP extract _validate_req_and_create_ports

Eventually we want to call _validate_req_and_create_ports before we
call the scheduler, but first we just need to split
allocate_for_instance cleanly into two pieces.

The follow on patchs will try to fold nets and ports into the
ProcessedNetworkRequestList object, to complete the clean split.

Part of blueprint prep-for-network-aware-scheduling-ocata

Change-Id: Icfc0b3d9211e68d98b58b25f9d078502ee3130e0

commit_message:
WIP: remove nets param from _update_ports_for_instance

All the return values from _update_ports_for_instance that are passed
into get_instance_nw_info can actually by generated from our existing
ProcessedNetworkRequest object and the nets dictionary outside of
_update_ports_for_instance.

Once we do that, we can remove the nets parameter from
_update_ports_for_instance, so we have a much clearer idea of what is
needed to execute _update_ports_for_instance.

Part of blueprint prep-for-network-aware-scheduling-ocata

Change-Id: I815446537d7e1d343b21e1d5b762afe3007ad4d6

commit_message:
WIP: remove uses of network in _update_ports_for_instance

We need to stop passing into _update_ports_for_instance the raw dict we
get back from neutron, partly because we need to send this information
across RPC in later patches, partly so we can better understand the real
information flow.

A step towards that is adding network_dns_name into the existing
versioned object we are passing in, and stop passing network into both
_populate_neutron_extension_values and _update_port_dns_name

blueprint prep-for-network-aware-scheduling-ocata

Co-Authored-By: Sarafraj Singh <sarafraj.singh@intel.com>

Change-Id: Ia3df143374a4a49b8f001748a184c6700a63d360

bits of allocate_for_instance that happen after it, so we have the ports
created before we call the scheduler, so we know if IP addresses need to
be scheduled or not.

As such, we are making sure all the information from the create ports

the refresh info cache phase.

requests_and_created_ports argument.

commit_message:
Objectify requests_and_created_ports

We need to split out the port create into a separate function from the
bits of allocate_for_instance that happen after it, so we have the ports
created before we call the scheduler, so we know if IP addresses need to
be scheduled or not.

As such, we are making sure all the information from the create ports
phase is objectified, and then pass that into the update ports phase and
the refresh info cache phase.

So we start with the _update_ports_for_instance, and converting the
requests_and_created_ports argument.

blueprint prep-for-network-aware-scheduling-ocata

Co-Authored-By: Sarafraj Singh <sarafraj.singh@intel.com>
Change-Id: I6cc5314584edf21745ad80f51d0936f578f4aad1

newtwork, instead add a processed network request to the list.

WIP: make allocate_for_instance take consistent args

Currently the neutron one takes its arguments differently to the other
network apis, this makes it consistent. To make it easier to add a new
argument in the next patch.

commit_message:
WIP: Modify allocate_for_instance to skip create_ports

Look at skipping port create if the ProcessedNetworkRequestList is passed
into allocate_for_instance.

Also modifies nova-network and the base api to take the
processed_requests parameter, but nova-network just ignores the
parameter for now.

Change-Id: I06f3efbf5e74798bd4b94956f7244056faf0cdd4

This is a no-op for nova-network, and is a rename of
_validate_req_and_create_ports for neutron.

This will get called before doing any scheduling to make sure all the

Change-Id: Iffa49c50196c2c0939760b39403960abda2ec8a6

commit_message:
WIP: introduce pre_allocate_for_instance method.

This is a no-op for nova-network, and is a rename of
_validate_req_and_create_ports for neutron.

This will get called before doing any scheduling to make sure all the
ports are created, and we have the information on the network segments
and what ips are needed before we do any scheduling.

Change-Id: Iffa49c50196c2c0939760b39403960abda2ec8a6

subject: Remove get_bash_code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-10 22:00:19.000000000', 'files': ['rst2bash/parser.py'], 'message': 'Remove get_bash_code

This patch removes get_bash_code. Getter methods are usually only added
when reading the attribute directly is not sufficient, which is not the
case here.

Also, the only caller of the method has no effect and is removed by the
patch as well.

Change-Id: I496d17e53903c93a30749196a5de6a7e776d03f9
'}]
commit_message:
Remove get_bash_code

This patch removes get_bash_code. Getter methods are usually only added
when reading the attribute directly is not sufficient, which is not the
case here.

Also, the only caller of the method has no effect and is removed by the
patch as well.

Change-Id: I496d17e53903c93a30749196a5de6a7e776d03f9

So tests should be updated to enable 'assign_to_all_nodes'
paramater for clusters.
For more info see:

Change-Id: Ib3d8b48076a0597a08cd273d5be361ce4cbd902d
Closes-Bug: 1632010
"}]
commit_message:
Allow public network assignment for all nodes

By default settings public network can be
assignment only to nodes with controller role.
So tests should be updated to enable 'assign_to_all_nodes'
paramater for clusters.
For more info see:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/292356/

Change-Id: Ib3d8b48076a0597a08cd273d5be361ce4cbd902d
Closes-Bug: 1632010

subject: Allow public network assignment for all nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-11 10:32:56.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/test_cli.py'], 'message': "Allow public network assignment for all nodes

By default settings public network can be
assignment only to nodes with controller role.
So tests should be updated to enable 'assign_to_all_nodes'
paramater for clusters.
For more info see:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/292356/

Change-Id: Ib3d8b48076a0597a08cd273d5be361ce4cbd902d
Closes-Bug: 1632010
"}]
commit_message:
Allow public network assignment for all nodes

By default settings public network can be
assignment only to nodes with controller role.
So tests should be updated to enable 'assign_to_all_nodes'
paramater for clusters.
For more info see:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/292356/

Change-Id: Ib3d8b48076a0597a08cd273d5be361ce4cbd902d
Closes-Bug: 1632010

subject: VMAX driver - Ocata new feature documentation
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2017-01-11 09:41:12.000000000', 'files': ['doc/config-reference/source/block-storage/drivers/emc-vmax-driver.rst'], 'message': 'VMAX driver - Ocata new feature documentation

Feature documentation for Volume Replication,
Attach/detach snapshots, Storage assisted volume migration,
Compression support and Generic Volume Group. VMAX2 is no

Change-Id: If9bf8b72dc90d413363ae2ce249bf55c7cbe4aa2
Closes-Bug: #1652033
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - Ocata new feature documentation

Feature documentation for Volume Replication,
Attach/detach snapshots, Storage assisted volume migration,
Compression support and Generic Volume Group. VMAX2 is no
longer supported

Change-Id: If9bf8b72dc90d413363ae2ce249bf55c7cbe4aa2
Closes-Bug: #1652033

commit_message:
add more detailed output to aclmanager

Print the names of the files we expect to be updating for each project
as they are found, since some repositories may use the same file for
permission settings.

Change-Id: I1a18d6916b99c6c5ce55306a6d9d13ecac4973bd
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Fix quotas override
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-10 16:49:16.000000000', 'files': ['manila_ui/dashboards/project/shares/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Fix quotas override

If we override the default quotas from horizon to
add the manila quotas we should be overriding
all of them to avoid causing issues on the
update default quotas workflow

Change-Id: Ia48808703743a17b7f0e1446963742372b05f7d6
Closes-Bug: 1655393
(cherry picked from commit 37c8c2d34be360b862c4fc4563fe7bbfdb2e81a6)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix quotas override

If we override the default quotas from horizon to
add the manila quotas we should be overriding
all of them to avoid causing issues on the
update default quotas workflow

Change-Id: Ia48808703743a17b7f0e1446963742372b05f7d6
Closes-Bug: 1655393
(cherry picked from commit 37c8c2d34be360b862c4fc4563fe7bbfdb2e81a6)

commit_message:
Fix quotas override

If we override the default quotas from horizon to
add the manila quotas we should be overriding
all of them to avoid causing issues on the
update default quotas workflow

Change-Id: Ia48808703743a17b7f0e1446963742372b05f7d6
Closes-Bug: 1655393

  should always work.
* The task detail patch contained a template, not a link. Change text

Releasenotes: REmove link to document that does not exist anymore.

commit_message:
Fix broken links

Contributor guide:

* Replace absolute link with in-tree relative one that
  should always work.
* The task detail patch contained a template, not a link. Change text
  accordingly.

Change-Id: Id72c7fba272090c5f439980ad58db48db42faa16
Releasenotes: REmove link to document that does not exist anymore.

commit_message:
Added UT for floating ips with dns

This patch adds several unit tests that verify a floating IP's DNS
information is properly sent to the external DNS service in all cases
where a new DNS recordset would need to be created.

Change-Id: If9bdfa31624bbf0c403f0c447a9e75978bde172d
Closes-bug: #1655378

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-10 21:10:22.000000000', 'files': ['templates/keystone-httpd.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Disable WSGIScriptReloading

This change simply disables mod_wsgi from automatically restarting apps
when the wsgi scripts are touched (or updated).  This seems like the
desired outcome since we do not want keystone to reload until we
explicitly trigger an Apache restart.

Change-Id: Ib714e8de4e42c5680b3133a9df7b9748dd6c6a88
'}]
commit_message:
Disable WSGIScriptReloading

This change simply disables mod_wsgi from automatically restarting apps
when the wsgi scripts are touched (or updated).  This seems like the
desired outcome since we do not want keystone to reload until we
explicitly trigger an Apache restart.

Change-Id: Ib714e8de4e42c5680b3133a9df7b9748dd6c6a88

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-11 07:12:57.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Resolve create_nova_conf_neutron not found issue

On OVN compute node, only n-cpu service is enabled. Thus, some
library codes are not sourced and create_nova_conf_neutron could
not be found during nova setup. Source the neutron-legacy in
plugin.sh.

Change-Id: I776c34da11b4a9464076f712821f99276d9e3ea2
Closes-Bug: #1653835
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve create_nova_conf_neutron not found issue

On OVN compute node, only n-cpu service is enabled. Thus, some
library codes are not sourced and create_nova_conf_neutron could
not be found during nova setup. Source the neutron-legacy in
plugin.sh.

Change-Id: I776c34da11b4a9464076f712821f99276d9e3ea2
Closes-Bug: #1653835

subject: Add jsonmodels requirement
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-27 09:28:50.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add jsonmodels requirement

- Is the library actively maintained?

  The last commit in the library was almost a year ago but the owner of
  the library is active on github. The code base itself is not large 1k
  LOC and all the promised features are implemented.

- Is the library good code?

  Yes, the code looks good and tested.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?

  Yes, package is licensed as 3-clause BSD.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  No but it is available on PyPI.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  I could not find any other package in the requirements that allows
  definition of models, and is able to serialize them to python natives
  primitives and JSON.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  We would like to use this library in Dragonflow to implement model
  classes with JSON as their backend.

  See:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/410298/
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/414984/

Change-Id: I7a8035fdf75ac348f09c4445b7938e315a01f1bf
'}]
commit_message:
Add jsonmodels requirement

- Is the library actively maintained?

  The last commit in the library was almost a year ago but the owner of
  the library is active on github. The code base itself is not large 1k
  LOC and all the promised features are implemented.

- Is the library good code?

  Yes, the code looks good and tested.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes.

- Is the library license compatible?

  Yes, package is licensed as 3-clause BSD.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

  No but it is available on PyPI.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

  I could not find any other package in the requirements that allows
  definition of models, and is able to serialize them to python natives
  primitives and JSON.

- Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
  infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course)
  Which?

  We would like to use this library in Dragonflow to implement model
  classes with JSON as their backend.

  See:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/410298/
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/414984/

Change-Id: I7a8035fdf75ac348f09c4445b7938e315a01f1bf

checke process is finished.

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-22 19:16:36.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Add Constraints support and missing bindep.txt dependencies

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove os-brick.

Finally, it also adds libxml2 and libxslt to bindep.txt for use when
building cryptography.

Change-Id: I3fbe4acbdf0281c91801ff7d09de6e9043915939
"}]
commit_message:
Add Constraints support and missing bindep.txt dependencies

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove os-brick.

Finally, it also adds libxml2 and libxslt to bindep.txt for use when
building cryptography.

Change-Id: I3fbe4acbdf0281c91801ff7d09de6e9043915939

commit_message:
Revert "Ignore heartbeats lock fails"

It seems that there are at least two level of ruby-stomp brokenness and
the fact that the mutex in original commit is locked actually means
there is no heartbeat received in time and we need to do something about
this.

This reverts commit 8318d7056556337f17f596edad9d7eed48ec3ca5.

Partial-Bug: #1644618
Change-Id: I565f430d17bcee2c50c0ddc8ecc11f3dc8b420ed
(cherry picked from commit 13b4d0f38e2a3e1c4d0ac0d91a7bce1dc23d7c8a)
(cherry picked from commit 64ab61d3ddb36cf956c6da0fb52a72c8f6f9590e)

commit_message:
Fix wrong column change to Logical_Switch_Port when neutron port update

When neutron router port was updated(e.g. Admin state down up), 'type' column
in Logical_Switch_Port was changed from router to ''. It broke patch-pair in
south DB.

Change-Id: I60ed355983162a5043c488749b871efb8e164ed8
Closes-Bug: #1653120
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

subject: Fix eventlet monkey_patch
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-11 01:46:37.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/cmd/xjob.py'], 'message': "Fix eventlet monkey_patch

1. What is the problem
After patch 416771 is merged, we change to use registered tricircle
command to start our api and xjob instead of python script, this
introduces a problem that eventlet.monkey_patch is not correctly
executed so xjob fails to handle RPC request.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Directly execute eventlet.monkey_patch in cmd/xjob.py without
checking if it's imported as a module or run by python script.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
No new features

Change-Id: I56d1491b0353f64beeb75d652bbd01cdf932b044
"}]
commit_message:
Fix eventlet monkey_patch

1. What is the problem
After patch 416771 is merged, we change to use registered tricircle
command to start our api and xjob instead of python script, this
introduces a problem that eventlet.monkey_patch is not correctly
executed so xjob fails to handle RPC request.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Directly execute eventlet.monkey_patch in cmd/xjob.py without
checking if it's imported as a module or run by python script.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
No new features

Change-Id: I56d1491b0353f64beeb75d652bbd01cdf932b044

subject: Add construct lib for data parsing
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-03 18:30:03.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add construct lib for data parsing

The python construct lib can be used to facilitate parsing of binary data,
for example network protocols.  It is documented here:
http://construct.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

An example of this library in openstack is in parsing network
switch LLDP data as implemented here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/406496/.
It simplifies the description of the LLDP structures and makes parsing of bit
and byte fields relatively straightforward.

The construct lib is licensed under the MIT license.  It supports Python 2.7
and 3.5.

This lib appears to be actively maintained, the latest release was on
12/31/16 in the git repository
https://github.com/construct/construct/releases.

Change-Id: I5debba09e832a541b6d139856bb601f31da4a7ba
'}]
commit_message:
Add construct lib for data parsing

The python construct lib can be used to facilitate parsing of binary data,
for example network protocols.  It is documented here:
http://construct.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

An example of this library in openstack is in parsing network
switch LLDP data as implemented here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/406496/.
It simplifies the description of the LLDP structures and makes parsing of bit
and byte fields relatively straightforward.

The construct lib is licensed under the MIT license.  It supports Python 2.7
and 3.5.

This lib appears to be actively maintained, the latest release was on
12/31/16 in the git repository
https://github.com/construct/construct/releases.

Change-Id: I5debba09e832a541b6d139856bb601f31da4a7ba

subject: Use i18n to translate msg in LOG.xxx()
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-01-09 02:21:49.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/pluginutils.py', 'heat/engine/resources/aws/lb/loadbalancer.py', 'heat/api/middleware/ssl.py', 'heat/engine/clients/__init__.py', 'heat/engine/clients/os/keystone/heat_keystoneclient.py'], 'message': 'Use i18n to translate msg in LOG.xxx()

1.Help messages and output info should support oslo.i18n. So we
should use oslo.i18n in LOG.warning()/LOG.error()/ LOG.info()

2.Not all files need to translate msg, tests directory and dev directory

Change-Id: Iced712f8833e90f3570497cd033713bdc34c27da
'}]
commit_message:
Use i18n to translate msg in LOG.xxx()

1.Help messages and output info should support oslo.i18n. So we
should use oslo.i18n in LOG.warning()/LOG.error()/ LOG.info()
/LOG.critical()/LOG.exception().

2.Not all files need to translate msg, tests directory and dev directory
are faced with developers, so they need to nothing.

The more information as follow:
 [1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html
 [2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/usage.html

Co-Authored-By: shizhihui <zhihui.shi@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: Iced712f8833e90f3570497cd033713bdc34c27da

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-01-09 11:42:07.000000000', 'files': ['reno/config.py', 'reno/scanner.py', 'releasenotes/notes/custom-tag-versions-d02028b6d35db967.yaml'], 'message': "Add support for custom tag version schemes

This change adds the ability to specify regular expressions to define a
customised versioning scheme for release tags and pre-release tags.

By default this change supports the current versioning scheme used by
OpenStack.

To customise, update the config.yaml file with the appropriate values.
For example, for tags with versions like 'v1.0.0' and pre-release
versions like 'v1.0.0rc1' the following could be added to config.yaml:

release_tag_re: 'v\d\.\d\.\d(rc\d+)?'
pre_release_tag_re: '(?P<pre_release>rc\d+$)'

Change-Id: I7539fdeada14a73ae4e18a125bb0e3947f08e8d1
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for custom tag version schemes

This change adds the ability to specify regular expressions to define a
customised versioning scheme for release tags and pre-release tags.

By default this change supports the current versioning scheme used by
OpenStack.

To customise, update the config.yaml file with the appropriate values.
For example, for tags with versions like 'v1.0.0' and pre-release
versions like 'v1.0.0rc1' the following could be added to config.yaml:

release_tag_re: 'v\d\.\d\.\d(rc\d+)?'
pre_release_tag_re: '(?P<pre_release>rc\d+$)'

Change-Id: I7539fdeada14a73ae4e18a125bb0e3947f08e8d1

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-11-03 16:16:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/volume/encryptors/test_luks.py', 'nova/volume/encryptors/luks.py', 'etc/nova/rootwrap.d/compute.filters', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "VM with Encrypted Vol throws error on hard reboot

Analysis: While attaching volume to instance, Nova calls
connect_volume, this returns connection_info which
includes 'device_path' that shows the device path in computer host.
With encrypted volume, after the above steps,it needs to decrypt
the device.It creates a decrypted device with 'cryptsetup open',and
then make device_path in connection_info refer
to the new decrypted device.

When rebooting an instance, Nova instance is shut down without any
detaching operations. This seems incorrect, ideally it should detach
encryptor when powering off, and re-attach when starting.

Change-Id: I9427d67080c5cbab84bbcdc24f37673abb301df3
Closes-Bug: #1597234
Co-Authored-By: lisali <xiaoyan.li@intel.com>
"}]
commit_message:
VM with Encrypted Vol throws error on hard reboot

Analysis: While attaching volume to instance, Nova calls
connect_volume, this returns connection_info which
includes 'device_path' that shows the device path in computer host.
With encrypted volume, after the above steps,it needs to decrypt
the device.It creates a decrypted device with 'cryptsetup open',and
then make device_path in connection_info refer
to the new decrypted device.

When rebooting an instance, Nova instance is shut down without any
detaching operations. This seems incorrect, ideally it should detach
encryptor when powering off, and re-attach when starting.

Change-Id: I9427d67080c5cbab84bbcdc24f37673abb301df3
Closes-Bug: #1597234
Co-Authored-By: lisali <xiaoyan.li@intel.com>

subject: Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-04 00:53:50.000000000', 'files': ['tools/install_venv.py'], 'message': "Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()

As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function.
When they are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the
Python interpreter. In this patch we have known main() got return
values(eg:0, 1), but it can't specifies exit status when terminate
the main thread by unusing sys.exit(). So when using sys.exit(main())
instead of main() may be more readable and reasonable.

Change-Id: Ie69b3a22dd1ddcd5586fc72f452cd162787f2f6f
"}]
commit_message:
Using sys.exit(main()) instead of main()

As we known, Exceptions are raised by the sys.exit() function.
When they are not handled, no stack traceback is printed in the
Python interpreter. In this patch we have known main() got return
values(eg:0, 1), but it can't specifies exit status when terminate
the main thread by unusing sys.exit(). So when using sys.exit(main())
instead of main() may be more readable and reasonable.

Change-Id: Ie69b3a22dd1ddcd5586fc72f452cd162787f2f6f

pyroute2: Up the constraints for namespace improv

namespaces. This will help with the Kuryr container-in-VM use cases.

subject: Devstack failed for OVS DB connection modification
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-06 08:03:57.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/networking-ovn'], 'message': 'Devstack failed for OVS DB connection modification

Caused by this ovs commit:
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/84d0ca5d00fe01b29163236d48fa0f9105687149
To improve security, the NB and SB ovsdb daemons no longer
have open ptcp connections by default.  This is a change in
behavior from previous versions, users wishing to use TCP
connections to the NB/SB daemons can either request that
a passive TCP connection be used via ovn-ctl command-line
options (e.g. via OVN_CTL_OPTS/OVN_NORTHD_OPTS in startup
scripts):
    --db-sb-create-insecure-remote=yes
    --db-nb-create-insecure-remote=yes

Thus add option to devstack:
    --db-nb-create-insecure-remote=$DB_NB_INSECURE_REMOTE
    --db-sb-create-insecure-remote=$DB_SB_INSECURE_REMOTE

Change-Id: Ic57b971c8f35235fcaf3a5200de3f18e5166cdc1
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Devstack failed for OVS DB connection modification

Caused by this ovs commit:
https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/84d0ca5d00fe01b29163236d48fa0f9105687149
To improve security, the NB and SB ovsdb daemons no longer
have open ptcp connections by default.  This is a change in
behavior from previous versions, users wishing to use TCP
connections to the NB/SB daemons can either request that
a passive TCP connection be used via ovn-ctl command-line
options (e.g. via OVN_CTL_OPTS/OVN_NORTHD_OPTS in startup
scripts):
    --db-sb-create-insecure-remote=yes
    --db-nb-create-insecure-remote=yes

Thus add option to devstack:
    --db-nb-create-insecure-remote=$DB_NB_INSECURE_REMOTE
    --db-sb-create-insecure-remote=$DB_SB_INSECURE_REMOTE

Change-Id: Ic57b971c8f35235fcaf3a5200de3f18e5166cdc1
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

commit_message:
Role based resource access control - get workflows

We already supported role based api access control, this series patches
will implement resource access control for mistral, so that
administrator could define the rules of resource accessibility, e.g.
admin user could get/delete/update the workflows of other tenants
according to the policy.

TODO:
- Implement update workflow by admin
- Implement delete workflow by admin
- Implement for other resources(workfbook/execution/task/action, etc.)

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-rbac

Change-Id: I8b00e8a260a74457ad037ee7322a7cba9ae34fab

subject: Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-03 02:42:31.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/messaging.py'], 'message': 'Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher

oslo.messaging allow dispatcher to restrict endpoint methods since
5.11.0 in d3a8f280ebd6fd12865fd20c4d772774e39aefa2, set with
DefaultRPCAccessPolicy to fix FutureWarning like:

"The access_policy argument is changing its default value to <class
'oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.DefaultRPCAccessPolicy'> in version '?',
please update the code to explicitly set None as the value:
access_policy defaults to LegacyRPCAccessPolicy which exposes private
methods. Explicitly set access_policy to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy or
ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy.

Change-Id: I169d187c757dc97f447dad9a441a3d8d7e91b046
'}]
commit_message:
Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher

oslo.messaging allow dispatcher to restrict endpoint methods since
5.11.0 in d3a8f280ebd6fd12865fd20c4d772774e39aefa2, set with
DefaultRPCAccessPolicy to fix FutureWarning like:

"The access_policy argument is changing its default value to <class
'oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.DefaultRPCAccessPolicy'> in version '?',
please update the code to explicitly set None as the value:
access_policy defaults to LegacyRPCAccessPolicy which exposes private
methods. Explicitly set access_policy to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy or
ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy.

Change-Id: I169d187c757dc97f447dad9a441a3d8d7e91b046

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-01-11 02:54:24.000000000', 'files': ['zun/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_manager.py', 'devstack/lib/zun', 'zun/container/driver.py', 'zun/tests/unit/container/docker/test_docker_driver.py', 'zun/tests/unit/db/test_image.py', 'zun/db/etcd/models.py', 'zun/tests/unit/db/test_container.py', 'zun/tests/unit/api/base.py', 'devstack/gate_hook.sh', 'zun/container/docker/driver.py', 'zun/tests/unit/db/test_zun_service.py', 'zun/compute/manager.py', 'zun/tests/unit/container/base.py', 'zun/tests/unit/api/controllers/v1/test_containers.py', 'zun/db/etcd/api.py', 'zun/tests/unit/objects/test_container.py', 'zun/api/controllers/v1/containers.py', 'zun/common/singleton.py'], 'message': "Enable etcd DB backend testing pipeline

As disussed in project plan, we decided to adopt etcd to store
container data which is faster and more flexible than mysql.

This commit enable etcd DB backend testing pipeline in Zun
and adjust the code correspondingly:

1. Set the value of 'db_type' to 'etcd' when runing etcd
   pipeline: 'gate-zun-devstack-dsvm-docker-etcd-nv'.
2. Drop the 'get_XXX_by_id' methods from etcd API since 'id'
   attribute makes no sense in etcd data model.
3. Adjust DB related test cases.

After the etcd related code been well tested, we'll change the

Change-Id: I06ac9b719ce93898cd4f67f1c7bdc2e0803e086e
"}]
commit_message:
Enable etcd DB backend testing pipeline

As disussed in project plan, we decided to adopt etcd to store
container data which is faster and more flexible than mysql.

This commit enable etcd DB backend testing pipeline in Zun
and adjust the code correspondingly:

1. Set the value of 'db_type' to 'etcd' when runing etcd
   pipeline: 'gate-zun-devstack-dsvm-docker-etcd-nv'.
2. Drop the 'get_XXX_by_id' methods from etcd API since 'id'
   attribute makes no sense in etcd data model.
3. Adjust DB related test cases.
4. Make etcd write request thead-safe.

After the etcd related code been well tested, we'll change the
default DB type from 'mysql' to 'etcd'.

Part of blueprint etcd-db-driver

Change-Id: I06ac9b719ce93898cd4f67f1c7bdc2e0803e086e

_display_stack_lists has been made specifically for stack-delete, if a
user wants to delete more than one stacks then it can be costly to make

commit_message:
Commands displays operated stacks instead of all the stacks

Added two methods _display_stack_lists and _display_single_list_stack.
_display_stack_lists has been made specifically for stack-delete, if a
user wants to delete more than one stacks then it can be costly to make
a API call for every deleted stacks. All the lists are collected and
then relevant stacks are displayed.

_display_single_list_stack is used to display to the stack, a get call
is made for a specific stack and stack is displayed.

Change-Id: Iba00bfbae9747fe591acc191e05e204fa1d9c9bb

commit_message:
Commands displays operated stacks instead of all the stacks

Added two methods _display_stack_lists and _display_single_list_stack.
_display_stack_lists has been made specifically for stack-delete, if a
user wants to delete more than one stacks then it can be costly to make
a API call for every deleted stacks. All the lists are collected and
then relevant stacks are displayed.

_display_single_list_stack is used to display to the stack, a get call
is made for a specific stack and stack is displayed.

Change-Id: If16a846797afcf1d24b98de37ca01241eeca1135
Closes-Bug: #1432533

commit_message:
Remove unused init_only kwarg from wsgi app init

Since d8673cb256e17fec05788907fce66898a36ddcf2 the init_only
kwarg is no longer used in the compute API wsgi app setup.
This patch removes it along with it's usage throughout the
compute REST API unit tests where it was used to isolate
testing of extensions, which is not valid anymore as all
extensions are enabled and we removed the ability to
whitelist/blacklist them.

Change-Id: I2f58b7944d0f7d7c05683238474954a65a617ec3

commit_message:
add a single unified calendar file

In addition to each series-specific calendar, prepare a single global
ICS file with all calendar events in it.

Change-Id: I3b66a343d1d0eac19c212c26957cc98ecbc062de
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Delete RoleAssignment if user/group does not exist

Currently deleting a user/group directly results
in stack containing RoleAssignment resource stuck
in DELETE_FAILED, when deleting the stack.This patch
fixes it.

Related-Bug: #1614400
(cherry picked from commit 1bb21c5bb3e1612cf4478465c1aa5a022b45f983)

Change-Id: Ib62d1898ed105f599a8d852885f69bc45bd420b4

commit_message:
Instal jq before deploy.sh in OVB jobs

This will be used by the TLS everywhere job on the CA setup part (which
runs before the undercloud install), and is also used by the undercloud
anyway, so we install this from the start.

Change-Id: I471dc7d872fda11dc4e48ec23d412ab0256c666d

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-12 10:15:36.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Don't trace on ImageNotFound in delete_image_on_error

The point of the delete_image_on_error decorator is to
cleanup an image used during snapshot operations, so it
makes little sense to log an exception trace if the image
delete fails because the image no longer exists, which it
might not since _snapshot_instance method will proactively
delete non-active images in certain situations.

So let's just handle the ImageNotFound and ignore it.

Change-Id: I14e061a28678ad28e38bd185e3d0a35cae41a9cf
Closes-Bug: #1648574
(cherry picked from commit 2bb70e7b15e6cfef4652e2e49c4e02d151d2dbdf)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't trace on ImageNotFound in delete_image_on_error

The point of the delete_image_on_error decorator is to
cleanup an image used during snapshot operations, so it
makes little sense to log an exception trace if the image
delete fails because the image no longer exists, which it
might not since _snapshot_instance method will proactively
delete non-active images in certain situations.

So let's just handle the ImageNotFound and ignore it.

Change-Id: I14e061a28678ad28e38bd185e3d0a35cae41a9cf
Closes-Bug: #1648574
(cherry picked from commit 2bb70e7b15e6cfef4652e2e49c4e02d151d2dbdf)

commit_message:
Add structure for Devstack plugin

This review creates the structure for the Devstack plugin and
prints to the console to ensure its execution in the gate.

Follow-up reviews will do more useful stuff like setting up
the environment for our functional testing (ldap, federation).

Depends-On: Ia8d07b4295ca165be01e44466c95d5275f596e83

Change-Id: I820ae355ae8f3183fee2b8207e3c17e8bd10dc17

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-23 06:42:29.000000000', 'files': ['lib/keystone', 'stackrc'], 'message': "Add new parameter RECREATE_KEYSTONE_DB

If 'RECREATE_KEYSTONE_DB=False' database won't be recreated.
It would be useful for multinode Grenade tests for Keystone. This parameter
will help us to deploy multiple services on different machines talking to
the same DB.

Devstack recreates Keystone DB each time during Keystone service installation.
If our controller node is already deployed, Keystone DB already contains
important information about OpenStack services and their endpoints. When
the second Keystone node is being deployed, we don't want to delete
records about controllers' services endpoints.

Partially-Implements: bp rolling-upgrade-testing

Change-Id: Ia8d07b4295ca165be01e44466c95d5275f596e83
(cherry picked from commit ea3e87d4e5a7a23870e86bbe133064a99e9519cf)
"}]
commit_message:
Add new parameter RECREATE_KEYSTONE_DB

If 'RECREATE_KEYSTONE_DB=False' database won't be recreated.
It would be useful for multinode Grenade tests for Keystone. This parameter
will help us to deploy multiple services on different machines talking to
the same DB.

Devstack recreates Keystone DB each time during Keystone service installation.
If our controller node is already deployed, Keystone DB already contains
important information about OpenStack services and their endpoints. When
the second Keystone node is being deployed, we don't want to delete
records about controllers' services endpoints.

Partially-Implements: bp rolling-upgrade-testing

Change-Id: Ia8d07b4295ca165be01e44466c95d5275f596e83
(cherry picked from commit ea3e87d4e5a7a23870e86bbe133064a99e9519cf)

commit_message:
update aclmanager to use default series argument

Instead of requiring the series argument, look at the default that the
rest of the scripts use. There is still a command line option for
overriding the default.

Change-Id: I7168b4786ac8f275da1ff0cd177268b3a4c20c17
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
